5. Stir in the chopped parsley and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper as needed.

1. For the garlic bread, preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Slice the Italian bread in half lengthwise. In a small bowl, mix the softened butter and minced garlic. Spread the garlic butter mixture evenly onto the cut side of the bread halves.
2. Place the bread on a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until golden and crispy. Slice into individual servings.
3. Serve the spaghetti carbonara with garlic bread on the side.

Day 4: Vegetable Stir-fry with Tofu and Brown Rice

Ingredients:

* 1 cup brown rice
* 2 cups water
* 1 lb firm tofu, drained and cubed
* 1/4 cup soy sauce
* 2 tbsp rice vinegar
* 2 tbsp honey or maple syrup
* 1 tbsp cornstarch
* 2 tbsp vegetable oil
* 2 cups broccoli florets
* 1 red bell pepper, sliced
* 1 cup snap peas
* 2 cloves garlic, minced
* 1 tbsp grated fresh ginger

Instructions:

1. In a medium saucepan, bring the brown rice and water to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 40-45 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and tender.
2. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey or maple syrup, and cornstarch. Set aside.
3. In a large non-stick skillet or wok, heat 1 tbsp of vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the tofu and cook until golden and crispy, about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove the tofu from the skillet and set aside.
4. In the same skillet, heat the remaining 1 tbsp of vegetable oil. Add the broccoli, bell pepper, and snap peas, and stir-fry for 4-5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
5. Add the garlic and ginger to the skillet, and stir-fry for another minute. Stir in the prepared sauce and cooked tofu, and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.
6. Serve the vegetable stir-fry with tofu over brown rice.

Day 5: Beef Fajitas with Sautéed Onions and Bell Peppers

Ingredients:

* 1 lb beef flank steak, thinly sliced
* 1/4 cup lime juice
* 1/4 cup vegetable oil
* 2 cloves garlic, minced
* 1 tsp ground cumin
* 1 tsp chili powder
* Salt and pepper, to taste
* 1 large onion, thinly sliced
* 2 bell peppers, thinly sliced
* 8 small flour tortillas
* Optional toppings: avocado, sour cream, salsa, shredded cheese, cilantro

Instructions:

1. In a large resealable plastic bag, combine lime juice, 2 tbsp of vegetable oil, garlic, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Add the sliced beef and marinate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours in the refrigerator.
2. Heat 1 tbsp of vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Remove the beef from the marinade, letting any excess liquid drip off. Cook the beef for 3-4 minutes per side, or until cooked to your desired level of doneness. Transfer the beef to a plate and cover with
